brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of Somnarus diagnostic technology for
      diagnosis of sleep apnea in human subjects. This includes evaluation of Somnarus technology
      in Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) and Central Sleep Apnea (CSA), including Cheyne - Stokes
      respiration (CSR).

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of SomnaPatch With Polysomnography in Sleep Disordered Breathing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Able to understand and sign the informed consent

          -  Able to comply with visits and follow ups included in this protocol

          -  Ages 20-85 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  An unstable medical condition, acute or chronic, that in the opinion of the
             investigator puts the subject at health risks related this trial or interferes with
             the clinical trial and data collection.

          -  Skin rash on the nose or on the maxillary area.

          -  A history of skin allergy to medical tape, and hypoallergenic tapes.

          -  A history of skin cancer on the nose or on the maxillary area.

          -  A history of the base of skull fractures, facial fractures

study_pop.textblock:
Patient who have been diagnosed with sleep disordered breathing (apnea or Cheyne-Stokes
        respiration)

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Somnarus Sleep Apnea Diagnostic Technology SomnaPatch With Polysomnography in Sleep Disordered Breathing

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Prospective
